Package ussr.model

An abstract model of a modular robot to be used from the controller.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ActBasedController Interface that a controller can implement to be executed by a scheduler thread instead of having its own thread.
Controller Interface the simulator expects user-defined controllers to implement, allowing hardware to be associated with the controller and the controller to be started in its own thread.
NativeControllerProvider Controller implementation for NativeController
PhysicsActuator A physics engine representation of an actuator: can actuate two module components relative to each other.
PhysicsSensor A physics engine representation of a sensor: can read the value of the sensor and allows the corresponding model to be set.
 

Class Summary
ActControllerImpl Controller implementation that provides the activate method expressed in terms of the methods from ActBasedController.
Actuator An abstract actuator for a modular robot: can actuate two module components relative to each other.
Connector An abstract connector for a modular robot: can connect to other connectors, provide information about other connectors available for connection, and can provide information about its connection status.
ControllerImpl Abstract class providing a default implementation of the Controller interface.
Entity Abstract class defining common behavior for entities in the simulator, namely the ability to have properties (strings with a key-value structure) defined on the entity.
Module A module is the basic unit from which the modular robot is built.
NativeController A controller with a native implementation, bridged to a controller implementing the NativeControllerProvider interface.
RemoteControllerConnection Used to create TCP server for a remote controller
Sensor An abstract sensor for a modular robot: can sense a value
 

Package ussr.model Description

An abstract model of a modular robot to be used from the controller. The central class Module defines the module that a controller references and uses to interact with the simulated world. This package is independent of the underlying physics engine.
